article:
A 'jack chain' is a type of chain made of thin wire, with figure-eight-shaped
links, and loops at right angles to each other. Jack chains are often used to
suspend fixtures such as lights or signs, for decorative purposes, or as part of
a cable lock. [http://www.halebros.com/chains/jack_chains.html Hale Bros.
Standard & Custom Jack Chains ]

Jack chain may be manufactured as either single-jack chain or as double-jack
chain. If double-jack, the lower loop is formed of two strands of wire rather
than just one as in a single-jack.

A jack chain is a tool attached to a toothed chain for moving logs. [http://www.answers.com/topic/jack-
chain jack chain: Definition and Much More from Answers.com ]

A jack chain is a form of arm protection for the 15th century infantry soldier
who typically was not dressed in plate armor but wore a padded arming jacket
(âjackâ) to protect his upper body. http://www.historiclife.com/images/Rese-
arch/jacks/Full/36ursu06_jack.jpg
